intro: Vincetoxicum fradinii, commonly known as the red baneberry, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range from white to pink. The plant produces clusters of bright red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Vincetoxicum fradinii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
